intro: Billardiera dorrienii, commonly known as the dwarf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to southeastern Australia. It typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus trees, forming dense clusters that can cover large areas of the host. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pale green flowers that are often clustered in umbels. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Billardiera dorrienii plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for native wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
